captions.text:
Hey guys, it’s Ro! Welcome to another Nerdy
Nummies!

Today, as you know, it’s the holiday season!
So we’re gonna be making something
holiday themed, something to keep up warm!

We’re gonna be making some hot cocoa! And,
for the first on Nerdy Nummies,

we’re gonna be making those cute little
cookies called side of the cup cookies.

That sit on the side of your teacup or hot
cocoa cup or coffee cup.
OK, so let’s get started!

The first thing that we’re gonna do is make
our sugar cookies, and I’m using a

pre-made sugar cookie package, but you can
use your favorite sugar cookie

recipe if you want to, I’m just doing this
to save time.

So what you’re gonna do is open it up, merp!
Take your big mixing bowl and pour
your mixture in, berp-boop-boop-boo-boo-boo-booooo!
Ba-nee!

Now you’re gonna add 1 egg, and then 1/3
cup of butter.

And then you’re gonna take 1 tablespoon
of flour.

Now you’re just gonna mix it all together until
everything is evenly combined.

After I mixed it up in the blender I’m just
using my hands, it’s almost there, it’s

still a little bit sticky so you can just
take a little bit extra flour,

sprinkle it on there, until your cookie dough
isn’t so sticky.

Now you’re just gonna take a little bit
of flour, sprinkle it down on the table

so that the cookie dough doesn’t stick to
the table.
Spread it around.

Boom! Flatten it out, take a rolling pin,
and you’re just gonna roll it flat.

Now you’re gonna take your little 8-Bit
Heart cookie cutter, I bought this at

on online store at Etsy, so I’ll put a link
down below, but you can use

any kind of cookie cutter that you’d like.
They even have side of the cup cookie

cutters that already have a built in notch, but I’m
gonna show you how to make it if
you just want to use a regular cookie cutter.

Alright, so you’re just gonna cut out a
bunch of hearts, and put the cookies

on the pan. Once you got all your little 8
bit hearts on the cookie sheet,

what we’re gonna do is cut out the little
notches. All you’re gonna need is a

sharp cutting knife. And what I did, is you’re
just gonna count 1, 2, 3…
On the 3rd point, we’re gonna cut him out.

You're not gonna cut all the way up, you’re just leaving
a little groove for it to sit on
the side of the cup.

Alright, here we go, I just wanted you guys
to take a look,

this is what they’ll look like. And now
you’re gonna heat your oven to 350
and we’re gonna bake these for about 7 minutes.

And you want to keep you eye on them, because
as soon as they start to turn
golden brown they’re ready!

And while these are baking we’re gonna head
over to the kitchen and we’re gonna
make some heart cocoa!
Yum-yum-yum-yum-yum!

To make our hot cocoa, the first thing that
you’re gonna do is you're gonna take 2 saucepans

and put them on the stove. You’re gonna
fill one of them with boiling water,

in the 2nd pan, we’re not gonna turn the
heat on yet, you’re gonna combine

1/3 cup of cocoa powder, 1/2 a cup of regular
sugar, and just a pinch of salt.

Once your dry ingredients are combined you’re
gonna take 1/3 cup of your
boiling water, and add it to the dry ingredients.

Then you’re gonna turn up the heat to a
slight boil, and stir everything together
until everythings evenly combined.

Once your hot cocoa’s at a light boil, you’re
going to turn down your heat, let it

simmer for 2 minutes, just keep stirring it,
so it gets really thick, and then

we’re gonna add 3-1/2 cups of milk, and
then stir it in and re-heat it.

After you add your 3-1/2 cups of milk and
you mix it up, you’re gonna turn

your heat up, but don’t bring it to a boil,
just right underneath.

And also, you can use any kind of milk that
you want, so if you have a

sensitivity to dairy, you can use soy milk
or almond milk, I’m using

regular milk, but you can use any kind of
milk that you like.

Once your cocoa is hot, you’re gonna remove
it from the heat and we’re gonna
add 1 teaspoon of vanilla extract.
That’s the last step!

Ooooh! Now our hot cocoa is ready, let’s
go put it all together!

Our hot cocoa’s all ready, our cookies are fresh
out of the oven, make sure

they’ve had plenty of time to cool before
you do this.

A lot of people just leave them plain, and
just stick them on the side of the cup

just plain, but I’m gonna be adding a little
bit of red frosting on top.

And, this is just red cookie icing, and I
put it in a plastic bag with a number

2 tip, and I’m just gonna be
tracing the inner part of the cookie.

Once you’re all done frosting your cookies,
I took the hot cocoa off the stove,

this recipe makes about 4 cups, and I poured
it into a pot with a little

pour spigot, I’m just gonna pour my hot
cocoa in, be careful, it’s hot.

This is optional, I’m just adding 1/8th
a cup of half and half, it will cool
down your hot cocoa just a little bit.

Now I’m just gonna put a little bit of whipped
cream on the top, because I love whipped
cream. Or you can do marshmallows!
Boop!
Bewp!

You’re just gonna stick a little cookie
on the side!

Last but not least, I’m just gonna sprinkle
a little bit of cinnamon on top
because I love cinnamon!
Come out! OK!
Ta-da!

Here you have it! This is 8-Bit Heart Cocoa,
it was perfect for the holiday season,
something nice and warm!

Thanks you guys for suggesting it, if you
have any other holiday themed ideas

please let me know, leave me a comment down
below.

And, follow me on Facebook and Twitter for
lots of pictures, I love to post pictures.

And, I like to post fan pictures, so if you
make this, send them to me on Facebook
and I will post them!
Alright, thanks you guys!
Bye-bye!

Oh! Before I forgot, this cute little cup,
I found it at Target, if anybody

is wondering. With the little red handle and
the red inside, it’s by the brand
Threshold I believe.
OK, ah, just trying to be helpful!
OK, thanks you guys, bye-bye!
